page.title: 17MINES AND QUARRIES
page.content: The rocks in the area were affected by the intrusion of{granite forming nearby Bodmin Moor and Kit Hill 300 million years ago. The local {shales}and{mudstones}were hardened by the heat and pressure and hot fluids formed rich{mineral veins}in the cracks. Remains of{quarries}are found at {Appledore, Coombegate, Sleeve, {Cholwell}and{Newbridge.}These supplied stone for older farm buildings, bridges, hedgerows and roads in the area, but are now very overgrown. A small disused{mine}with{shaft and{spoil tip}is found at{Colquite } (357677). This was a working mine in the late 19th century and produced 38 tons of{pyrites}in 1870. High quality {rhodanite}(used as a rare decorative stone) was mined at a shallow working in{Pencrebar Wood}(353681).
